Reviews.Title: “A GOOD ECONOMICAL OPTION”
Reviews.Author: android501
Reviews.Content: You've got to keep in mind that this hotel is one of the cheapest in the area. Location is close enough to the train station. Free shuttle service was extremely convenient. Driver was nice. Room was average. I would return given that I'm a bargain hunter.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty! Scary!”
Reviews.Author: Terri T
Reviews.Content: I learned a lesson -- don't expect much from a low-priced room in a high-priced city. If, like me, you are forced to lay over in Miami for transportation connections, plan on spending more for a clean, quiet room in a better neighborhood. This place is nothing but a dump. As a single woman I found walking to my room by shirtless, beer-bellied guys hanging out on the balcony very unsettling. I had been looking forward to going out for a late supper, but there was no way I was going to walk past the gauntlet of unsavory characters again. I bolted and chained the door and turned on the TV to try to drown out the exceptionally loud band playing at a raucous bar next door. The carpet was disgusting, the bed hard as rock, no blanket and the sink and tub were peeling paint. In the morning, again, guys hanging out smoking cigarettes on the balcony/walkway. No way was I about to get into the rattletrap elevator for fear of one of those guys getting on with me -- I walked the five flights down to the lobby. The staff never asked how my stay was -- they're probably tired of hearing about it! I was never so glad to get out of a place.

Reviews.Title: “Crack-tel! Beware!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: terrep263
Reviews.Content: Beware this is a very dangerous and unsafe hotel! Check in Sunday March 4th several women trolling for drugs when we went to check in. we took a chance and checked in any way when we went to the room it was filthy, old and moldy. I was very disappointed in this choice hotel and feel that the corporate office needs to investigate. If I or a loved one with me had been injuried or harmed i would most certainly have sued. This palce is very dangerous!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel + Cheap Staff with Cheap attitude=Rodeway Inn Miami”
Reviews.Author: Reggaerocker
Reviews.Content: This hotel isnt the worst dump. I needed some place affordable for my stay in Miami this past weekend for the 9 Mile Reggae festival. Its affordable, it was, what Ill call "sanitary". Beds and bathrooms i dont worry too much about only because I always bring my own bedding, and shower shoes. The carpet wreaked of urine...but again I didnt let that get to me too much mostly because this was just a place to lay my head and get ready for the day/evening. This isnt a hotel where you leisurely spend your time. The pool looks like someone died in it, the elevators are days away from collapse..but you know the worst part of this place? I can deal with crummy bathrooms, smelly carpets, and hot water going in and out...but bad customer service, I cant condone. Everyone behind the counter was rude, curt, and discourteous. The manager looked and acted like a pimp, and his "workers" were just as disgustingly rude. This place is reasonably priced considering the location, but this place would be better 10 fold if they bag Mr. Big and other the b____es behind the counter.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location for airport and port. Not many other redeeming qualities.”
Reviews.Author: MaestroNewJersey
Reviews.Content: I should have read the reviews before staying here. I found the hotel extremely disappointing, and I understood this was a budget hotel. The location is convenient to the airport and port and they have a decent shuttle service if you don't mind waiting a while. They will also let you park your car when on a cruise for a very reasonable fee including the shuttle service, which is great if you don't mind waiting for the shuttle before and after the cruise. The pool was OK, although not heated. That's it for the good stuff. Now the bad. My room on the fifth floor facing the highway was unbelievably noisy. Very poor night sleep. The carpets were terrible - I did not take off my shoes. The TV's were flat, but they still did not work well - terrible picture, poor selection of channels. The furnishings were awful. The hallways were in poor condition. The area of the city, while convenient, was not pleasant. I thought the price, while inexpensive, was too much for the poor quality. This felt like a place that should be charging under $50 per room and not over $80. I have stayed in much nicer budget hotels - this one felt like too much of a compromise. I recommend you spend another $20 and stay somewhere better.

Reviews.Title: “Very Scary”
Reviews.Author: rjeffery1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Jan 2012 and I so wish I could have stayed someplace else. First let me tell you everything that was good, before I tell you everything that was bad. The front desk staff were very nice, the cost was nice (only $65 per night), and they let me check in super early- at 12 noon. The location is Iffy. The rooms were absolutely disgusting. The carpets need to be replaced. The bottoms of my white socks were black after only walking around the room for 10 minutes. The walls are super thin. I heard EVERYTHING and I mean EVERYTHING. The people who stayed there were very creepy. I walked by window to discover someone peeping in between the crack of the curtains. I didn't feel safe that I kept my valuables in the trunk of my car instead of my room. My room also faced the highway. Don't try to get a good nights rest. If the constant sound of traffic didn't keep you up, the people in the hotel will. I would have complained to the staff, but honestly, I tried to make sure that I limited the amount of time I spent in my room. Miami is such a beautiful city, that I went out and enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “It's not that bad!”
Reviews.Author: Umpalumpa14588
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel four different times. Each time was fine, no real problems, average experience and expectations. If you are used to staying at the Ritz, why would you stay at the Rodeway? Don't leave horrible reviews because your standards are too high. We use this hotel to stay before and after cruising. The location to the airport is convenient, and the free shuttle is great. We have never had to wait more that 20 minutes for them to pick us up. The front desk staff have always been friendly and accomodating. Treat people how you want to be treated. Only once did we have a problem with a room, and they were quick to move us without hassle. Their wifi leaves a lot to be desired, but I've been told room location makes a difference for that. The rooms are rough around the edges and could use a serious rennovation (not just a bad paint job and a new shower curtain), but no bugs, and clean enough for one night. I don't walk around with bare feet, and I always Lysol my sheets no matter where I stay, anyway. I've always felt safe, and never seen questionable people in the parking lot. The staff even checked us in at 10am when we arrived after a cruise, when check in wasn't until 3pm. The pool has always been clean and cool, the housekeeping staff are super friendly. University Bar and Patio is attached, and super convenient to walk down to hang out, have a drink and enjoy a meal. They used to offer hotel guests a $5 voucher, and now it is only a choice of coffee, juice or toast, but again, you get what you pay for, and I've been very happy with everything I get for $75/night.

Reviews.Title: “filthy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yangming L Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: it is a cheap hotel, with convenient shuttle service, but it has filthy rooms it is a cheap hotel, with convenient shuttle service, but it has filthy rooms it is a cheap hotel, with convenient shuttle service, but it has filthy rooms it is a cheap hotel, with convenient shuttle service, but it has filthy rooms it is a cheap hotel, with convenient shuttle service, but it has filthy rooms it is a cheap hotel, with convenient shuttle service, but it has filthy rooms

Reviews.Title: “Aweful!”
Reviews.Author: Dee S
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst hotel I've stayed in and i travel a lot for work. The staff were extremely rude and uncoperative, even cutting me off when I was talking! The room was dirty and smelled. The doors have no security chains, they're all missing and they insist on having your room number displayed in your car window! Not very smart or safety conscious for female travelers. I found a much better hotel the following day with friendly staff and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Leon K
Reviews.Content: Dirty, cock roach infested, unsafe, and very noisy. This motel has not been updated in 25 years or more. It is very noisy (even with ear plugs) because you are a stone throw away from the Dolphin Expressway. The carpet and ceramic floors are filthy along with the furniture and bedding. Someone tried entering my room in the middle of the night, thank goodness for deadbolt and door chain. Photos online are very deceiving. RECOMMEND - DO NOT STAY AT THIS MOTEL. This motel should not be part of the Choice Hotel chain. Should be called "Last Choice".

Reviews.Title: “Serviceable for a short stay, Great location for downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: kuffup
Reviews.Content: I stayed January 28, 2012 for one night after Jimmy Buffett (what a another great show!!). The Rodeway Inn Miami is an average motel which serves basic needs of a traveler not expectating a 5 star resort for a short stay. The entire motel is in need of some basic upkeeping, new paint, a power washer and some bleach around the common area's would do wonders. The parking is a nice setup, covered and free. The front desk staff was efficient and polite and gave some pointers about how to get to the American Airlines arena, which was very helpful. The room was clean and served the basic need of a clean place to lay your head down after a long fun day. The wifi worked very well all over the motel. The bar and grill located on site was good, however service a bit spotty. By far the best part of this property is price ($60/night) is the rate I got and LOCATION, its perfect for downtown Miami, the noise from the highway as others have stated is very loud. I would not stay for more than a couple of days at best, but for a night or two is fine. As with most hotels, you get what you pay for and yes, the common areas can be called dirty, but overall this is a 2 star motel in a good location for Miami.

Reviews.Title: “poor but useful”
Reviews.Author: sekk
Reviews.Content: arrived at 1 am of jan 19th. not a good impression. the rooms are old but not bad. not a dirty hotel. many guests said "1 night and go": they are completely right because the hotel is near the airport (21 dollars), it has a shuttle service, wifi but, on the other side is old, noisy (the highway is close), the service is almost rude, the breakfast is a warm drink and...nothing else! i had no security problem nor i met "special" people.

Reviews.Title: “Worste Hotel I have EVER stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: Bridget x
Reviews.Content: This was by far the filthiest scariest hotel I have ever stayed at. We chose this Hotel online based on the proximity to our Cruise Port and price. The first room they placed us in was so filty and smelled like squatters have lived there for months. We asked for another room and they did accomidate that request, but my son left his backpack inthe room (with is 3DS) and when we called about it they claimed that they didn't find one in there!! The ammenities listed are a JOKE...everything was broken. The televisions in the room were from 1980 and barely got reception. The dressers were broken and cracked. The bathroom had certain "hair" all over the seat and around the floor...which was also in the shower. We wouldn't go outside after dark because the area was scary and there were people arguing in the parking lot and possible drug dealings going on. The photos listed were probably from 20 years ago because this hotel is run down...I agree with a previous comment, this is for prostitutes and john, not for families.

Reviews.Title: “IT S JUST LIKE SLEEPING ON THE HIGHWAY”
Reviews.Author: Patrice D
Reviews.Content: It took the free shutle one hour to pick me up @ airport. The room is ok. But EXTREMELY NOISY. My room was directly by the Dolphin highway.. Slept fore less than 3 hours. It a very busy highway no matter what time. Spend 20$ more and go somewhere else..... A eviter si vous voulez dormir. La chambre donne sur une 8 voies. Quand ce ne sont pas les voitures ou les camions, ce sont les avions! Bien que situe a 15mn de l aeroport, l hotel est sur le passage de la piste d atterrissage ! La chambre etait ok pour le prix....mais n hesitez pas a depenser un peu plus et aller ailleurs !

Reviews.Title: “Some rooms are better than others”
Reviews.Author: fearlessbiker916
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in worse but I guess you take pot luck with which room you get, or maybe you need to challenge the desk if you get a horrible one. Mine had a little kitchen that had definately seen better days and overall, the furnishings were definately ready for replacement, however my son's room was much nicer and looked recently refurbished. Two plus points, it has free, fairly secure, partly covered parking and the University Restaurant attached does great burgers and breakfasts with good value and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Carrol H
Reviews.Content: The rooms were filthy, sinks and tub painted over, beds nasty. This is a drug dealing and prostitute hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Value and Good Service”
Reviews.Author: bettyhoyde
Reviews.Content: Well we arrived in Miami at the Rode Way Inn Miami Airport. I don't know why they call it Miami Airport hotel as they are a 15 minute drive to the airport from the hotel. This is an older hotel but a fair price for what is offered. Free covered parking which helps to keep the car cool during the day. We were on the 5th floor so the view was nice so that we could watch the fire works over the buildings. We are located behind a highway so the noise is loud day and night. Downstairs they offer a very comfortable restaurant called University restaurant with an outdoor patio. Try the Solvalaki as it is very tasty. The prices were good their as well. We would come back here. The pool was a little cool but refreshing. See you Again!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but it has disadvantages”
Reviews.Author: mWrite
Reviews.Content: I ended up at this hotel, because my friends decided to choose the hotel based on price. I found the staff to be the best at hotel. If one negative thing to mention about them, I followed few times how front desk employees commented customers in Spanish, not knowing that I understood. Few comments were pretty mean. But if you do not understand, you do not know. The Room, was big enough, but they are shabby. I killed three bugs at the rooms (not ants, flies nor big asian cockroaches), but I did not recognize them. For entomologists: bugs were black/red, big antennas, total length 1" and fast. So I kept my stuff in my suitcase all the time. Cleanliness was very good, if we measure cleaning employee work, but linen/towels are old (read worn). Carpet is brown, probably became brown over the time, as my socks became brown too. Some cigarette burns can be seen on carpeting and other places in bathroom, meaning that my room and friends too were old smokers rooms, converted to non smoking by sign on the door. Wall papers & paint are falling some places. Paint in my room look pretty new and some of the staircases were painted during my stay too. Looks typical american way of renovation. Just paint over, hiding under. (falling paint is a) wrong or b) underneath is structual problems e.g. moisture). Last day I smelled cigarette smoke, probably came through ventilation. The ventilation vent in the bathroom was only dirty (non cleaned) place in the room. I can confirm other reviewers comments on elevators, that they are old and slow. You maybe want to have a room on the street side 4th or 5th floor. On street side below that the A/C unit can be disturbing. Pool side is towards Highway 836 (4-lane ea direction) creating continous traffic noise. That can be disturbing. The Amenities, Pool and Gym looked very nice, compared to other things at premises. Hotel offers also free transportation to Airport, Port of Miami and Bayside Marketplace, an outdoor shopping mall. The (two component) breakfast is served in the external restaurant called "University & Patio" and consists only coffee or tea OR orange juice and croissant or muffin or toast. I would rather exclude the breakfast from room rate and make the restaurant to offer complimentary orange juice(was very good) for hotel residents. Now they tried to sell decent breakfast for customers who were more or less pissed off about the breakfast. Of course the breakfast quantity is based on what the hotel is willing to pay, not the restaurant fault. WiFi/WLan is available at entire hotel, working nicely also at rooms too. The Location, closed to the airport is central at I95/highway 836 intersection and it is just like 5-6 miles from Miami Beach, which is reachable with public transportation, but it is questionable, which means that if you are looking beach holiday, choose a hotel at the Beach. Here the car becomes essential need. The hotel website promotes several things at walking distance, but as european, I disagree from security reasons to walk in the neighborhoods, except the hospitals. So at the end, hotel is well cleaned very old hotel with cheap price. I took my stay as an experience and rather will pay more for better location next time. I think that @choicehotel.com tells the best way: Rodeway Inn by Choice Hotels is defined as : "Hit the road affordably When youâ€™re on the road -- and on a budget -- you can still stay with a respected name: Rodeway Inn. Our great rates and free amenities will have you feeling good about your stay."

Reviews.Title: “only good thing was FD staff”
Reviews.Author: GeneralManager36
Reviews.Content: When I arrived I was please with the greeting and helpfulness of the front desk staff. But that is where the good things stopped. The parking lot first of all is extremely accident prone, you will be better off walking up the stairs cuz the elevator is older than Jesus, the room was OK (just ok). It was freezing in the room when we arrived but i guess thats to be expected in Miami. When I seen the blankets on the beds I thought they were curtains so i called the front desk to ask for some brown fuzzy blankets (like all the hotels have) and they told me that they didnt have any (when actually there were 2 in the drawers which i didnt find till we were leaving). So me and my family got ready for the football game (highschool) and went on our way. When we returned and finished our wonderful showers (yeah the shower was good) we went to lay down on the beds and we thought we were laying on the floors cuz the beds were so hard and the bed i was laying in was leaning to the side, i woke up 4 times during the night almost on the floor. Then the complimentary cont breakfast HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHHHAHAHAHA is a joke. You get a (only one per person on res) muffin or danish or toast i choose muffin but it was colder than the orange juice that they gave me by the way which was bout the size of the cups the dentise would use to rinse your mouth out. This place totally turned me away from EVER wanting to come to downtown miami ever again. Next time it will be the beach for us. Good luck if you choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cash is king”
Reviews.Author: DanielleCS
Reviews.Content: Actual quote when we asked if we could pay cash instead of using the credit card with which we booked the room. The beds we comfy, and we had plenty of hot pressurized water, which are really my only concerns when I'm staying at a hotel. We were able to catch a shuttle from MIA as well as to the Port of Miami the next day without a lot of hassle. The attached University Bar had delicious food and we had a good time watching the med students do karaoke.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!!!”
Reviews.Author: walrus99
Reviews.Content: Got off the plane and called hotel at 11:05 and the receptionist told me all shuttles stopped at 11:00, guess that was my fault for not seeing that. She was rude and ended up telling if I wanted a room to take a taxi. Everything was dirty and room smelled like it had just been deoderized for a smoker. Was not worth the money! Only had room on traffic side and it sounded like a drag strip most of the night. I should have stayed in the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: kunaldenver
Reviews.Content: recently stayed at this place for 4 nights - the hotel is pretty decent for the price you get a room.. no bed bugs, the room was clean. The location is the clincher. Would strongly recommend 'value buyers' to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Terrifying place to stay. Not relaxing. Reeks of disinfectant.”
Reviews.Author: Milo_and_Spooky
Reviews.Content: Creepy, dirty, dark, depressing. It looks like the stereotypical motel in the movies where a drug deal goes bad and people get murdered. Rooms smell of chemical perfumed disinfectant and it burns your nose and lungs... but you will be too afraid for your safety to open a window or door! We stayed at this hotel from 3pm to 10pm (never actually slept overnight, thank god!) because we had a late night flight and it was pouring rain in Miami. The hotel says it's "newly renovated" and had free WIFI, so we figured it would be a nice place to spend a few hours and relax. HA! NOOOO! We laid on top of the beds, just to watch tv and instantly became itchy. Nothing about this hotel was "newly renovated." The WIFI was extremely slow. The main picture of this hotel is deceiving. It looks a LOT worse and run-down in real life! Don't bother with this place.

Reviews.Title: “At least if it burnt down the bugs/sticky carpets would be gone!!!”
Reviews.Author: jamesjcw
Reviews.Content: What can you say about the rodeway inn??? Don't ever stay here... Don't even think about staying here!!! Even if you accidentally thought about staying here that would be a mistake!!! Do you get the picture... All the bad reviews are true. You would think that all the reviews couldn't be telling the truth about the rodeway and you are right. Any reviews that say anything positive about this place is a lie. The only good that I can say, and let me emphasize that this was THE ONLY GOOD PART of our stay was the food at the restaurant. Wow, it was the worst place I've ever had the misfortune of staying in. It made me want to sleep outside in the street under a bridge. If you decide to stay here, you may be the crazy.

Reviews.Title: “A dumpster!”
Reviews.Author: HRRtraveler
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here it is disgusting and 3rd World. The worst place I could imagine. Stay in your car first or bring lots of Lysol, roach spray and weapons!

Reviews.Title: “Low Rates and Fairly Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mqualls
Reviews.Content: Their rates are very reasonable. The room was a good size, slightly worn out, but still an ok room. Internet wasn't very reliable in my room, but I'm at fault for not asking for a room with internet at check-in. You can access the internet in other areas though. The breakfast is limited to 1 muffin and 1 extra-small juice or coffee. There is a restaurant down stairs in the office. Free transportation to the airport and to bayside. I give it 4 out 5 because, I couldn't find any other hotels that providing free transportation like this and the fact that their rates were very good. Don't expect anything fancy, but it is survivable. I would stay here again. Also, the train station is within walking distance, which allows you to travel pretty much anywhere in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “one of the worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: ginebrino
Reviews.Content: this is worst hotel I have ever been in my life. Dirty, ugly, full or weird people that were drugged. breakfast is minimal and disgusting. people in the reception were really unfriendly. On the pool no comment, just a hole with water right next to the highway. only good thing, the free ride to the airport

Reviews.Title: “Stay far far far away....”
Reviews.Author: Gracelyn G
Reviews.Content: Pay the extra money and stay around the corner at the SpringHill suites. The photo you see online is a fake. This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The staff was extremely rude. The rooms were dirty. We had roaches in our room. We had to get our own towels and toilet paper. We were there 5 days. The room was cleaned once. The only postive thing I could say about this hotel is the air conditoner worked well, and its close to the hospitals. The drivers were never available to take you hospital or pick you up. We waited sometimes for 30 minutes and no one showed up. The elevetor was broken all week. It's was the pits.

Reviews.Title: “we wont be back”
Reviews.Author: raquel147365
Reviews.Content: We had a room in the 4th floor which was full of small flying roaches and having a child with us it was not convenient so we asked for another room and we were given one in the second floor with the same problem. The pool was dirty and they just kept saying it was going to be opened the next day, we were there 3 days and my grandson didn't go the pool cause it was closed. Check out time is 11am but I wanted to stay until 6pm since my flight was at 9 and I asked a man behind the receptionist desk if he was the manager and he said no, I wanted to find out how much I could pay for the few hours and he told the other man there to charge me the full rate. I knew by the driver that I talked to first was indeed the manager. It was very unprofessional. I won't go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Next time, we'll cough up the extra dough”
Reviews.Author: nezume
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel and figured the reviews were pretty accurate but we could put up with the hotel for 1 1/2 days. We were on a tight budget and didn't really want to pay more for a hotel. Next time we will. The good things I can say are: 24 hr check-in**, 4 channels of new movies playing if you want to just kill a day in Miami, no bed bugs (when we were there), clean sheets, like everyone else says, the restaurant next door is great, and cheap, and it's nice to have the free shuttle to downtown, airport, and cruise port. **I now understand why they say 24 hr check-in. You can't go into the lobby but they have a little window to talk to the check-in clerk, similar to what you might find at a movie theater. So nice after a long flight and arriving past 1 am. If it had been any worse we would have left and requested a full refund. It really suprises us that this is considered a choice hotel. After reading the reviews, I did not want to experience "sticky carpet" myself so I made sure to wear socks or shoes around the room. My husband thought they must be exaggerating but he confirmed that the carpet is in fact sticky. The beds are the most uncomfortable I have ever slept on including old youth camp mattresses. You can feel every spring in your back. There is mold behind the headboards, fire detector etc. The wallpaper is bubling or peeling pretty much everywhere you look, and underneath the sink there is a hole patched with cardboard! We actually didn't notice it at first but after talking with others in the shuttle they mentioned the patch under their sink and my husband checked under ours to discover what must be an identical match. The tub had a steady stream even when turned off and although it didn't bother us too much (the noise sort of drowned out the sound of the loud AC!) I would say this hotel is the furthest thing from "green" (others on the shuttle had the same steady stream as well). Overall the general grime and filth would lead me to spend more on a hotel in the future. I suppose the true essentials of clean sheets and non bed bugs might persuade others to deal with it, but it wasn't worth it for us.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away. I would rate it with -10 if that was an option.”
Reviews.Author: kikika32
Reviews.Content: Very rude staff, really really dirty rooms. And far away from anything. I have travel all over round the world that is far the worst hotel I ve ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare!!! Avoid!!!”
Reviews.Author: CookiesKorner
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at this hotel the night before our cruise. Shuttle took over 1 hr to pick us up and I had to move locations 3 times so that they could find us. The room given to us had a bathroom covered in hair. Second room only had a few hairs in tub. The rugs were filthy resulting in bottoms of white socks turning black. The walls in staircase are rotting away and leaking. I asked about the "Multi Million dollar reno" that was mentioned and was laughed at by the girls at the desk. They said, ya, we heared about that. Pool was dirty and so was pool furniture. This place has not been cleaned in years. We have another trip planned in December but it won't be at the Rodeway. This hotel is a nightmare! Only redeeming factor was restaurant on premises. Wonderful Greek Food!!! OPA!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Maintenance in a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janelle_flower
Reviews.Content: Rodeway Inn was so run down the bed sheets had cigarette burns plus it smelt like a public hospital. On the first day we had no blankets in the room so i called the front desk and they sent a blanket the blanket was so worn out it was so stiff like a mash up newspaper words can't decirbe that blanket it was long over due for throwing out. So i carried the blanket to the front desk to ask if i can get it changed and the receptionist told me no, there are no blankets again so i told her i can't sleep on this blanket, if i can talk to the maid she said the maid can't do anything so i told her i don't want the blanket that i will drop it of back to the laundry room when i went to the laundry room i asked the maid for another blanket and she changed it for me I got helped from the Maid that receptionist was no help at all. Come on Rodeway Inn upgrade your rooms and Linens

Reviews.Title: “Find you another hotel! They staff they have is so very didrespectful.”
Reviews.Author: class06
Reviews.Content: When you tell them that you will speak to the manager about the way the talked to you they tell you to go right ahead, they dont care. We never stay @ a place with poor service like this. Plus the bed had mice droppings in it.

Reviews.Title: “Parking lot not secure. I would avoid.”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaPeach87
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay at the hotel so I can't comment on the rooms. We did leave our car there while we went on a cruise ($5/night parking.) While we were gone someone siphoned ALL of the gas out of our vehicle. I have called the manager twice to alert her to the problem. I've left messages concerning "a security issue at the hotel" and no one has returned my call. I guess they don't care about security. Next time I will spend the $20/day to park at the port since that seems to be the only secure parking to be had.

Reviews.Title: “Honestly Not So Bad..”
Reviews.Author: Hannah1389
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rodeway Inn about a month ago with a large group of 34 people. Our accommodations there were pre-arranged and we had made the mistake of reading all about this place before we went down to Miami. Needless to say, were were freaking out and expecting the worst of the worst. There had been rumors of bedbugs, roaches, mold, anything that could possibly gross someone out was mentioned to be at this motel. We got there and did a check of all the rooms for bedbugs and found none. We all put our own sheets over the beds and slept in our sleeping bags and have all returned home with no bedbugs to bring home as souvenirs. The staff was fine, I didn't find them to be rude or un-accomodating; which is surprising considering we were a group of 34 college students and they could've been a LOT worse. We had ONE incident where 2 of the rooms found roaches in their rooms. Was it gross? Yes. Did we live? Yep. Honestly, if you are one of those neat freaks who is anal about the cleanliness of where you stay, this place is NOT for you. But if you can just rough it out, this place isn't so bad. We stayed there 6 nights and we honestly had a perfectly fine stay. I think people need to stop being so harsh on this place. For what you are paying to stay there, you can't expect to get some five star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: eagallant
Reviews.Content: There were 8 of us that stayed in 2 double rooms on our way to a Carnival cruise. The photos provided did not accurately depict the hotel and we felt cheated by that fact. The staff were rather rude, the lobby was dirty and the rooms had cockroaches. We arrived at 8pm, too late to change hotels, the room was prepaid and we would have lost the money we'd paid if we didn't stay. We checked in and had to use our shirts to cover our hands to open the doors through the lobby to the elevator & rooms. It was a glass door that had not been cleaned in a long time! There were not only fingerprints but a layer of grunge. When we went to the rooms, oh my is all I can day. The rooms were poorly lit, the beds were uncomfortable and the carpet was dirty. 1 room smelled of a chemical and the other room had cockroaches. The kids found them on the floor, 1 on the wall and 1 in their bed. Needless to say, my kids were very upset and freaking out. We didn't put any of our belongings on the floor and left the hotel as soon as we could in the morning. There is a restaurant/bar with outside patio in the hotel that was suppose to offer breakfast. We were 4 adults, 2 teens, 1 preteen & 1 baby. They gave us 3 breakfast 'vouchers'. The supper food was fairly priced & not bad but took at least an hour to get. Breakfast was horrible!! Small muffin, toast or croissant and coffee or juice. One of my girls waited a bit over an hour for her omelette, only to receive it with a long gray hair cooked right in it - nobody in the kitchen (which was open for view) had gray hair!! The only good thing we can say is that they had an airport and port shuttle at no charge. I've lodged a complaint with my travel site on this hotel it was so bad!

Reviews.Title: “Awful except for dinner at night”
Reviews.Author: lionelmesidor
Reviews.Content: Please, please, before traveling check the review on your hotel that you plan to stay. First, the room was smelling cigarette especially in the bathroom when the room was supposed to be a non-smoking one. Bathroom: Then, you can see RED MOLD on the head shower & toilet paper accessories. There was coat/paint to patch the wall. The place to put the soap in the bath was missing some paint?? Room: It was cleaned so the sheets. However, you can see the plug below the desk was removed and the wall were not paint properly. I strongly believe that they might hire a person who doesn't even know how to paint to do that job! Internet: When I arrived in the room, the internet was not working. I was advised by the front desk staff that it wasn't working for the past 24hour.. Food: The dinner was okay in terms of service, price and taste. However, their continental breakfast is only a snack: small muffin or 2 toast AND orange juice or coffee.That's all. I've stayed had various type of hotels to know what is a continental breakfast and Rodeway Inn does not have at all a continental breakfast. I was supposed to stay there for 2nights and by 6pm, I reserved another hotel to stay the following day. In short, don't stay there even someone pays you all expenses!

Reviews.Title: “Rude”
Reviews.Author: surfmomnsb
Reviews.Content: The worst place I have ever stayed...We were there in Jan. and it was cold outside...Yes Miami does get cold...The room had the air conditioner on when we arrived. We turned it off and went to eat. When we returned to the room we tried the heat. It did n't work I called the front desk and was told, "We do not guarantee heat for out rooms". We tried the hot water in the shower and that didn't work either....Rude people running the place...The room was not as clean but we had already spent our money and left at 6 am the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “The WORST hotel I have stayed in in my 61 years!!!”
Reviews.Author: KANTPUTT
Reviews.Content: Directions to hotel from airport were very poor. Arrived and checked in. Says the hotel has been renovated-NOT. The grounds very dirty and rundown. The room was dirty and carpet torn. TINY bathroom. Not a clock or alarm in the room. The free wifi didn't work throughout our stay-neither did the telephone. Upon check-out no discount for unavailable promised services. No coffee in room or lobby. The lobby is closed at night. The staff has a poor attitude. My wife truly HATED the place, but our stay was pre-paid. Never again will I do that!!!

Reviews.Title: “The only redeeming factor was the restaurant which was pretty good.”
Reviews.Author: dovechase
Reviews.Content: The only redeeming factor was the restaurant which was pretty good. I'll never stay there again. Their website said that they had just had a large renovation. This was completely untrue. Nothing has been changed there in years. The nonsmoking rooms reeked of smoke. I refused to shower there.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for night stays”
Reviews.Author: kaushikd12
Reviews.Content: Nice if you want to stay for the night at a cheap price

Reviews.Title: “The most horrible night ever!”
Reviews.Author: viausc
Reviews.Content: My husband, a large group of friends, and myself flew into Miami for a cruise. We needed a place to stay that was close to the port and decided on this hotel due to location and the fact that they offered a shuttle to the port. THIS WAS THE WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED! First off their website is decieving the rooms were so disgusting I slept with my close on and refused to shower for a fear of falling through the tub!!! There were 9 of us in 3 rooms and the men refused the leave the hotel to run for food or beverages. When we asked where the nearest places to eat were, we were told not to walk anywhere since we were in the worst possible location and might get robbed or even worse!!! I really sincerely would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone, not even , my worst enemy!

Reviews.Title: “Can't get worse than this... ( "worsest" )”
Reviews.Author: Virtualist
Reviews.Content: Checked-in around 8PM and my girlfriend started freaking out immediately after entering the room. The room was stinky and she was able to find 3 roaches in the room. No hair dryer or iron in the room. They needed $10 deposit to get a sucky iron from the front desk. No heater since they say it's "tropical climate". However, the night was cold since it was December and 34 degrees F. The Hotel advertises free continental breakfast, guess what, it's not continental and they were giving out vouchers for breakfast. We had 2 rooms (travelling with friends) and they only gave us 2 vouchers for 2 rooms claiming that the reservation said only 2 people when there are 2 beds in each room... Duh....

Reviews.Title: “ALL IS WORNG WITH THIS PLACE”
Reviews.Author: Roger1031
Reviews.Content: We had booked the room for 2 nights for 5 people. When we checked in the front-desk was very unresponsive. They didn't even try to make us feel comfortable ,not even a smile or a nod. They didn't care whether we stayed there or not. The hallways and elevators were in pathetic conditions. The paint was pealing off the walls and signs in the elevator were broken. We had a reservation for 5 people and had asked for a roll-away bed when we had made the reservation. But when we went there they didn't have roll-away beds so one of us ended sleeping on the floor. Next day when we went for breakfast the front-desk said that we had room only for 4 people and not 5 people so only 4 were allowed for breakfast. We showed our reservation to front-desk saying 5 people but the front-desk refused and said that her system showed only 4 people, so only 4 were allowed. So we ended up having breakfast outside. They say that they have free hi-speed wireless internet but we couldn't get any signal so we ended up paying for using the computer in the lobby. Also, all floors have ice machines but none of them are working.

Reviews.Title: “Only reason we stayed here was for the shuttles. The rest was pretty crappy.”
Reviews.Author: keltose
Reviews.Content: Only reason we stayed here was for the shuttles. The rest was pretty crappy.

Reviews.Title: “Please read review before u book, Very Poor”
Reviews.Author: TheBavers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this motel for one night with my partner in August 2010. We had a flight early in the morning from Miami airport so we wanted a hotel close to the airport. I booked this through BOOKING.COM and payed Â£45. I have never stayed in Miami before so we did not know what areas were good and what was bad. When we checked in I wasa little concerned as there was a security hut and a guard at the door. We checked in and it was very run down and dirty. They asked for a credit card but I insisted on paying cash as there was no way I was going to hand over my card details. We parked our car and tried to find our room. The halls were all outdoors and very run down. There was a sign saying it had just had a refurb. I could not see where from the outside. It seemed that the area in Miami the motel was in was not a very good one, this concerned us a little. We finally found our room and went in. The room was very basic and smelt of damp. The dead lock on the door was broken and there was no safe in the room. We felt that uncomfortable that at night we pushed our suit cases up to the door. The shower had no presure and was only luke warm and the paint was peeling off from the bathroom. What really appauld us was the floor. I took my shoes and socks off and was walking around in bare foot. After two minutes my partner said "LOOK AT YOUR FEET". They were black. The floor was that dirty that in 2 mins my feet were black. I wet a towel and rubbed it along the floor. The towel changed to black and the carpet changed colour. The floor could do with a really good clean. The TV reception was very poor and fuzzy and we gave up in the end. Also the internet/Wifi had little/no signal. It was noisey outside and there were Police sirens sounding all night outside. We found it hard to sleep. We only stayed the night as we had to get up at 4 am to check in for our flight and we checked in at 8pm that evening. Otherwise we would have moved hotel. The only plus side was it was close to the airport. We did not stay for the breakfast but if itn was anything like the room we would have passed anyway. We did not use the pool as it was on the otherside of the motel right next to a main highway. It looked dirty and very uninviting. Please only stay at this motel if you have to or if it is free and you are feeling brave.

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle does not make up for this dump....run as fast as you can”
Reviews.Author: Duckdoger
Reviews.Content: I normally disregard both the highest and lowest ratings when selecting this hotel so in spite of the numerous negative reviews, the recent "multi-million" dollar renovation and free shuttle service to airport and port I thought it can't be that bad....how wrong I was. I do not have caviar tastes and I am perfectally comfortable in MOtel 6, Super 8, etc. This is absolutely the dirtiest, flthiest chain hotel I have ever stayed in. It is worse than bad. The carpets and linens were gross (ended up using my own towel I had packed away), room reeked of smoke though it was non-smoking, A/C loud, oh and did I mention the jets flying overhead? As for the remodel, a new cheap flat screen with non-functioning remote and a new desk. As for the remodeling, imagine giving your 6 year old a paint brush and spackle and you have the results. I can go on and on but I won't bore you with the all of the other problems. And if you are arriving from the west coast be aware the sutte service ceases at 11:00. My flight was late and by the time I got my bags I had to take a cab (which ripped me off too going in circles because he coudln't find the place). The wait for the shuttle to the cruise ship was almost 2 hours. 1 van for all these people.....What did work well? The internet....Oh and the "free breakfast" consisted of a small microwaved roll and a 4 oz. glass of o.j.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with this location: I've paid more for worse places!”
Reviews.Author: jfromfay
Reviews.Content: I was really surprised when I read all the extremely negative reviews. Perhaps the management took them to heart, because when we arrived on 7-12-10, it was NOT bad at all. We have paid at least this much or more for carpeted ashtrays in the past, some of which didn't even give the little soaps/shampoos. All the staff we encountered was very efficient and polite. We called for a port shuttle and it arrived within 5 min. of when we were told it would. When we arrived at the hotel office, an extremely irate person was calling and calling (3 times just while I was waiting for a man to check out, and I could hear him from where I was standing) ; he seemed to think the shuttle driver should recognize him to pull over to pick him up rather than him flagging the shuttle down. We had just left the port, and the driver, my husband and I were all watching for more people to pick up, and not a soul made the least motion to the shuttle (it was plainly marked 'Rodeway Inn'). The lady at the desk was very patient with the customer on the phone, explaining to him that there was no way the driver could recognize him unless he flagged the shuttle down. We arrived at about 10:30 am and were allowed to check in right away, even though we said we could wait. We checked out at 6:00 am the next day and the 6:00 am (earliest one) airport shuttle headed out with 4 of us by 6:05. What one really must take into account is the price asked for the lodging, and remember that it is Miami we are talking about. I am extremely thrifty and checked out literally dozens of locations. The next price point up was in the high $80.00's, and believe me, no better than this one. Is it an older location? Definetly. But more imporantly, it is kept up (at least it is now). The tub & vanity were very recently resurfaced - and let's be honest, ladies, how many of us really consider taking a tub bath in anyone's tub but our own, our mother's or our sister's? Honestly, now. True, the floor paint in the outdoor corridors didn't all quite match for color, but it was fairly recently resurfaced/painted, as were the corridor walls. The room carpet, while not attractive, was clean (I felt it with my hands). We passed lots of open room doors - and I never caught a nasty whiff of anything anywhere. The stalest-smelling place was the elevator, and that only had the 'hot closet' smell you get anywhere in a hot climate. The floor corner behind the bathroom door could have benefited from the detail brush on a good vacuum, but it was dusty rather than cruddy or dirty floor. They are in the process of remodelling or setting up a salon area across the rear hall from the office, and there was none of the funky odor frequently associated with yucky carpet, damaged drywall or plumbing coming from that open door either Our linens and towels were all clean and soft (believe me, I checked them all.) The beds were inexpensive, but surprisingly comfy. Location: Great if you need to be near the University Hospital, etc. or for an overnight. I would suggest that you request a room not facing the main road (University Blvd?). The front wall is all window, and the door did have a gap at the bottom, so there was a lot of traffic noise. The door locked just fine. The pool and its area was nice and clean - I didn't swim as there were a lot of kids, but it all quieted down very nicely by 7-8 pm. Aside from the family-owned restaurant on-site, there are no restaurants nearby (Subway or something about 3 blocks away), which is the reason why I suggest it for an overnight or a 'have to be here' location. Now, the on-site restaurant: It was very good! My last experience with on-sites was horrible (mic. potato & fish stix for $12.99), so I was very aprehensive...until I took one look inside. Great Greek/American food and super service. Prices a bit high, but then again, it is Miami, and I'm not familiar with the area. There was only one young man taking care of both inside and outside: 8 or 9 tables of 2-6 people each, and the food came out hot, and though simple, it was nicely presented. We had lunch there, and 'to go' for supper in our room. Both were quick and hot. We wandered around a little bit to see the place, and I never got a creepy feeling. We saw a few people with 'Security' t-shirts on, esp. as it got dark. We saw no one loitering, even when sitting outside at 6:00 am for the shuttle. I felt comfortable enough going downstairs to the office after dark. They have safety mirrors mounted in all the blind spots we came across, plus some cameras. The snack/drink and ice machine areas were well-swept and looked to be either mopped or hosed regularly. The only drawback I found was that I thought guests had free internet access in the office, but the comp. was connected to some sort of an ATM-type pay kiosk. The comp. screen said I could insert a $1.00 bill, but the kiosk only took a credit card, and required its PIN. I was not at all familiar with that sort of system or the company name, so I did not use it after all: I decided it was worth the extra $3.00 to check in in person at the airport, rather than open up a credit card account to an unknown 3rd (4th, 5th....) party. All-in-all, I was very happy with the facility, esp. when the low price is factored in. Had I spent the $89.00 and up price other similar locations charged, I would have been much less happy. I would call it a 'no frills' hotel (because of the very plain rooms), except that it does have a nice, clean pool area and such a great family-owned restaurant on site. I feel it was a very good value. I will recommend it to friends, and if I need an overnight Miami location again, I will check this one first.

Reviews.Title: “I would never ever stay there again, very dirty.”
Reviews.Author: guima62
Reviews.Content: I am short of words when it comes to this hotel, it was so dirty and smelley, the bathtub was filthy I wouldn't even bath my dog in that bathtub. I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Filth Fleas and F**cking rude staff”
Reviews.Author: mrcbrs
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked as it was close to the Jackson Memorial Hotel. The room did not lock, it was filthy dirty and there were fleas in the room. We were shown 2 more rooms, all as bad We checked out and moved on

Reviews.Title: “The worst stay I have ever experience at any hotel”
Reviews.Author: denayap
Reviews.Content: I really wish I had checked this site before I booked a room at this hotel. I thought that since it was part of the Choice Priveleges program that it would be reputable but I guess I was sorely mistaken! I agree with so many of the reviews on this site. In fact every one that discourages any person who is even thinking of staying here. I unfortunately stayed here on friday, May 28th, 2010. This hotel stay was the worse that I have ever had! There are so many reasons. The free internet is a joke. It would not stay connected and whenever it did connect at all it was at low and very low connection before it would repeatedly disconnect over and over again. I was unable to complete my online school assignments! The lobby restaurant was not open the hours that were advertised on its door. The TV was a flat screen and looked all nice but it is like they say, looks can be deceiving. It was full of static and barely got reception. Not one channel came in clear. The cable hook up for the tv was hanging out of the wall through a hole. Half of the ice machines where out of order. Basically every other floor (there are 4) had signs on the machines indicating that they were out of order. There was pee in the stairwells. I reserved a room for two adults and got only one wash cloth. The door lock fell right out of the door and we had to repeatedly reinsert it to lock the door. Lastly there was no hot water at all so we were unable to take showers before our afternoon flight. This hotel is horrible and should be taken off of the list of choice privileges hotels because it really does not live up to the name that I thought that the program represented.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting. Wouldnt stay even if u paid me to!”
Reviews.Author: DeborahB3
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend that u never EVER put yourself through stayin in this hotel. its a shambles! we were only booked for the one night, thank god! on arrival, staff made no effort and were extremely rude. especially a female.i had to refuse to deal with her. she was ignorant and rude its dusgusting. the sights my family seen were horrific, drug dealing in the car park. sexual acts in the pool and lift area at night, the rooms didnt feel safe in the slightest, could hear everthing and it sounded like u were sleping with the door wide open. i witnessed the "cleaner" doing one of the rooms, horrible hard carpet was bein swept rather than hoovered or disinfected like it needed! bed linen was old hard and uncomfortable, i dread to think, i slept on the bed with clothed on wrapped in my own towel. shower flooded when on and rubish was left from previous visitors. we ate breakfast in the resteraunt in the mornin, and as it was only tea and toast it was ok. staff were unpleasant and unfriendly with a lack of care about customer satisfaction. when we were thankfully leaving we waited over an hour on the shuttle bus to return to take us to the port. i wouldnt wish this place on my worst enemy

Reviews.Title: “Ew-ew-EW!!!”
Reviews.Author: EastCoaster40
Reviews.Content: If there were negative clicks to rate this "hotel", I'd still be clicking. This was, by far, the WORST hotel I've ever stayed in..and I travel frequently and on a budget. Luckily we were only there for one night. If we weren't with a large group, I would have checked out (Like some of the smarter people in our group did). You know it's bad when the security guard advises you not to walk around the area..yet we were torn- the dangers outside or the dangers inside. I slept on top of the sheets and didn't shower- it was that disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel I will never Stay in again.”
Reviews.Author: Aingealmom
Reviews.Content: While the location of this Hotel is located halfway between the Port of Miami and the Miami Airport, you would think this would be ideal. However, it is location offers nothing around it other than the University of Miami's Medical buildings. Offering nothing in the way of stores or amenities within walking distances. The hotel itself has seen better days, while the rooms are clean enough, but the overall buidling is showing its age. The telephones did not work, the room was missing it's security lock. The sheets were not fitted and came off in the middle of the night. The one bright sport was the dinner resturant attached it food was good value and the staff friendly. Unlike the girls on the front desk whom treated our lack of phone problem with indiffrence. Do not try to save a buck at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here, everything is terrible, even the employees!!”
Reviews.Author: munidupi
Reviews.Content: Had to be very near hospital for 2 days, asked for a handicap room to no avail, said had elevators, which only the furthest was in use and it sounded like it was never checked and about to fall. Everything so dirty and smelly, 1st night did not sleep at all, put the AC in high to dismiss a bit the noise from the expressway and had no blankets, no hat water, call the ext #'s, no one answered at all. Next day asked for a change of room and was granted but everybody the was very rude. Forgot a nice pair of shoes and checkout, same day called regarding the shoes, after calling for 2 days, nobody found anything, Honesty is not a strong trait in the facility. WILL NEVER STAY THERE AGAIN.......

Reviews.Title: “NASTY!”
Reviews.Author: NCNICK
Reviews.Content: I did not make the reservation myself but once I heard Rodeway Inn, I should have opted to sleep on the street corner and save $55. My wife and I didn't even get under the covers, slept in our jeans and clothes we wore that day so less of our skin would be in contact with all the nastiness.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a joke in a "first world" country”
Reviews.Author: chapi2002
Reviews.Content: We stayed there because it was supposed to be simple but clean. It was far from that. 1. When we checked in the clerk ran around with a Polo shirt hanging out and unshaved. 2. Entering to our room we noticed a very unpleasant smell. Well to be honest it stank horrible there. 3. All bedlinen was dirty and with hair. When we went out we told the Front office clerk to change the linen. To our suprise the linen was only throughn on our bed we had to change the sheets ourself. Imagen that. 4. AC was not existant and in a horrible state of repair. 5. No coffee maker not even a hairdryer 6. There was a flat screen TV in the room but without a remote controll. We asked at the Front desk and the lady gave us the simple answer. There is no remote! 7. Telefon in the room never worked. 8. Second day we did not get any towels.. In my 20 years of travelling internationally I never had a worst hotel. Well travelling to the US I expect to have some official department checking on properties like this. My fellow travellers please stay away from this hotel. Even it is cheap. Well I know now why. The only fun and nice place is the University Restaurant. They do decent food and it is fun to go there. Unbelivable that such a great place is attached to such a lousy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AS FAR AWAY AS YOU CAN FROM THIS DIVE”
Reviews.Author: MikeWoodside
Reviews.Content: Made a one night reservation at this "hotel" without checking the reviews, big mistake. The hotel looks OK from the highway and looked conveniently located. Should have known when the very unfriendly girl at the front desk gave me the room key wrapped in a post-it note because they had run out of the little envelopes. The room smelled weird, when we opened the chest drawers we saw what looked like small roaches, we never took anything out of the suitcase. It was very cold that night in Miami and the heating unit blew cold air. The next morning we woke up to find out there was no hot water in the whole hotel, after many calls and trips to the front desk I was informed that there was someone coming to fix the boiler. To make a long story short, the hot water came back on at 12:00pm; checkout time is 11:00am. They wanted us to leave without taking a shower, the maid was also annoyed at us because we didn't leave the room and she had to finish to go home. Later that night while at a restaurant in South Beach, I noticed some itchy bumps on the left side of the back of my neck and scalp, as well as the knuckles of my fingers, they turned out to be BED BUG BITES!!!

Reviews.Title: “don't bother staying here”
Reviews.Author: jakeybird
Reviews.Content: Our plane was cancelled due to snow at Newark so we phoned expedia to find us a hotel for 1 night. It was 1 night too long, the room was disgusting carpet was dirty bathroom was filthy no enamel left on the bath it was that old. Did not feel safe at all had to put the suitcases against the door for fear of someone breaking in also we had to sleep on our own beach towels because the bed was not clean, and there was not much chance of getting a good nights sleep because of the freeway outside our room, I would not reccommend this place to anybody not even my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “paint it and burn it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: shadowlakemayor
Reviews.Content: OMG!!! First of all, I booked this without reading the reviews. Bad Mistake!! The shuttle was non existent so we took a taxi. Even before we walked in the door my daughter said, "Let's get outta here!". We had an overnight in Miami to catch a cruise the next day so I thought it was ok and it couldn't be that bad. Wrong!!! I persevered and we checked into adjoining rooms. The room stank! My daughter brought us over to their room and showed us the bloody booger on the sheet!!!! So, I swallowed my pride and my other daughter got on line and booked the Hyatt on Priceline for $77 a room in a 4 star hotel!!! I went to the front desk and told them that we were not staying because of the filth and they refunded my cc charges. Do not, unless you are an alcoholic or drug user, stay here. Believe the reviews. YUKKKKKKKKK!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have ever used.”
Reviews.Author: marydip
Reviews.Content: Even the Gideons don't visit this hotel. We booked this based on this hotel, being a member of the Choice Hotel Group.They offered inexpensive parking and free shuttle. We recommended it to three other couples and were really sorry to put them in this situation. The hotel was dirty, and you heard highway noise on one side and ambulance noise on the other. The food in the restaurant had mold on it .Do not use the shuttle unless you are prepared to wait an hour to two hours to get any service. I would not stay in this room if the rates were $5 per night. We plan on contacting Choice Hotels and recommend they remove it from their list of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “No way rodeway.”
Reviews.Author: Shipcrusin
Reviews.Content: Our experience stated out with calling the hotel for the shuttle service, after waiting an hour I called again and I was told to PAY ATTENTION. No one was friendly at all when checking in. Alot of talking among the employees and we were ignored. The room was so dirty and discusting it smelled like a bar. The bathroom was grosse. The carpet was so dirty. We had no towels. It took hours to get any after going down to the front desk acouple times and being told someone will bring them to us. We had a phone but it did not work to even call the desk. The shuttle service the next morning was a joke we ended up getting a cab to our cruise ship. I hope someone from corporate visits this hotel and you be the judge. Its discusting!!!

Reviews.Title: “digustingly filthy”
Reviews.Author: begland
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed it a more filthyer place,bathroom floor hadnt been cleaned, carpeting not vacuumed,tub an shower,dresser,toilet and seat,were all so filthy.the room smelled so bad not even a can of lysol changed the smell much.the pool was green.we and others had no towles or wash cloths,we made 3 trips to the office and 3hr later we were giver our towles from behind the desk ,they were there the hole time ,we had a phone but it didn't work,we couldn't call the desk.Shuttle didn't run much.we were left it the air port over an hr.,hotel 10min's away.We were not happy with CHOICE HOTELS INT. RODEWAY INN MIAMI FL

Reviews.Title: “Only if you enjoy staying in a sewer”
Reviews.Author: DIBOBOhio
Reviews.Content: We too, were not told there was no heat in the rooms when the temp dropped to 29. OUT OF ORDER - elevator, ATM, restroom urinal,computer, (which when it was working for an hour was .15/minute. Not good when people need to check airlines or to get boarding passes) room keys, one RUDE, SNOTTY female desk clerk who looked like she just got out of bed and did not know how to use a comb on her long tangled hair. She let customers stand while she was on the phone discussIng her work schedule. ALSO OUT OF ORDER shuttle service, and we asked for a 3:30AM wake up call so we could get an early flight. Think we got it? NOT Our first room had no towels or washclothes. When we requested some they told us they had no wash clothes, use hand towels instead. The second room was labled a handicapped room that we asked for, but the only hint of such was a walk in, dirty shower with no hand rails or shower chair. The rug was soaked and I am afraid to think of what it was soaked with. The halls and one working elevator were dirty and smelled of urine. THE JOINT WAS AN ABSOLUTE SEWER. I AM NOW CONTACTING THE MIAMI HEALTH DEPARTMENT AND BUILDING DEPARTMENT.

Reviews.Title: “CSI episode waiting to happen!”
Reviews.Author: Great-Adventurers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on a cruise in December for a week and when we returned to the Port of Miami we found out that the entire east coast was shut down due to a 2 foot snow blizzard. We are choice hotels members so naturally I just called the 1800# and asked for them to find us a hotel with a shuttle to the airport. They book us with Rodeway Inn Miami Airport. First we waited 2 HOURS at the airport for the shuttle to arrive. Then it just got worse: the shuttle driver was an independent buisness owner who drove a gross van and gave us his online business pitch all the way to the motel. The motel is located in a very sketchy part of town. The rooms are all facing the street. The knob for the dead bolt in our room was broken OFF. At least three of the electrical outlets didn't work at all, the bed was hard as a rock, the pillows were like air with a case on them. We stayed 15 minutes and then left to find another hotel. We would have been willing to lose the $65 for the night but they didn't charge us for the room.... our only + to this terrible terrible terrible place. (And we are not fancy people.... we have stayed in hotels in third world countries)

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS-- stay away!!!!”
Reviews.Author: traveler24Usa
Reviews.Content: I felt a bug on my arm in the middle of the night and I screamed and threw it off. I thought it was a one time incident so I didn't worry too much. The next evening I noticed bug bites on my hands, arms, and back, and more popped up later. They turned out to be BED BUG BITES and a week later they are still huge and itchy. Do NOT stay here, this place is a dump and the bathroom was disgusting. They are lucky I don't have time to sue them! I have traveled to many hotels in my lifetime and never have I been eaten alive by bed bugs!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Stag88
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through the ChoiceHotels.com which is the official website for the Comfort chain that includes Rodeway. We arrived MIA at 5:45 p.m. After we retrieved our luggage, we called Rodeway as instructed from the information sheet. The receptionist told us to go to level 2 and wait for the bus which would be there in 10 minutes. We waited 45 minutes and no bus came. I called Rodeway again. She said that she could not locate the driver and the bus should be there in any minutes. We waited for another 40 minutes and called again. She said that the bus had a flat tired and the driver had just replaced the tire. He is ready to leave the hotel. We waited again. We have seen many hotel buses multiple times but no Rodeway. After another 40 minutes, we knew the bus would not come for sure. We went to the lower level and took the taxi. When we got to Rodeway, the driver, Jose, was sitting outside chatting with the security guard. As soon as he saw us walking in, he jumped to the van and left. We were pretty upset and told our story to the receptionist. She said we could talk to the manager the next morning. The next morning, we asked to see Fredie. The lady at the front desk said he was busy and asked why. We told our story again. She said she would follow up. However, we were going to check out. All we could do was to write our story on the comment card. The hotel was dirty. There are elevators at each end of the building, one was not working. Our room is at the not working end. The other elevator had most button lights burned out. Most rooms, including our room, are facing an 8-lane freeway. Traffic was heavy all night that we could not sleep at all due to the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not that bad!”
Reviews.Author: Veveer
Reviews.Content: This motel is located just a few blocks away from downtown Miami and we paid $52 for a family of 4 with AAA card (about $58 with the tax) so we didn't expect Hilton. The place was old but clean, no unwanted animals. The staff was friendly. The breakfast was really simple (coffee, 2 toasts per person, butter) but it was enough to feed us and it is possible to buy more food in the restaurant. The highway is close and yeah it is noisy but the AC provided a constant level of noise that enabled us to sleep well. The shuttle to the port of Miami was free. They let us park our car there during our cruise for $5 a day. I only missed wifi. No reason to complain, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “not as bad as other reviews described”
Reviews.Author: NewfoundlandNewbie
Reviews.Content: friendly service, staff was nice ,freddy our shuttle driver was very informative. pool area was clean and tidy , elevator was in working order, tv and phone also. staff and resturant food was wonderful. hospital was near by and we needed it.. the hotel staff kept the place clean inside and out. the only problem i had was with the musty smell in the room and the peeling paint in the tub. as a stop over for a cruise i would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very dirty carpets, place wasn't very clean”
Reviews.Author: AnnMarie2
Reviews.Content: Restaurant service was o.k. Your continental breakfast is a joke. We were there 2 nights. We had 4 rooms which were reserved in August 2008. The last couple to get there Friday niight got a terrible room. Nothing in it but the bed. They wre given a different room the next morning but the damage was done. No we will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “It's the worst hotel ...”
Reviews.Author: Famtrip09
Reviews.Content: Please Don't stay in this Hotel! It's Horrible,all the outside is really dirty,the bath was cleaned,the toilet lid was broken,everything was in bad conditions walls,door,beds,AC smells bad,The only new was a desk with a big chair and TV.The Continental breakfat was a trick only included:coffe,small juice and toast,we order and paid for extra food It's was grease,the restaurant and hotel employees were friendy.But I will never stay in this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience I've had yet.”
Reviews.Author: wraithe
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Choice Privileges in August 2008, 4 rooms for 11 family members. Received my welcome to the Rodeway Inn emails on Tuesday Feb. 3, on Feb. 4 I got a call from Natasha in Sales & Marketing that Choice had overbooked the hotel and they were cancelling our reservations for Saturday the 7th. After a couple of calls, they decided they would honor my reservation. I arrived, expecting the efficiency that I'd reserved and ended up in a dump of a room that didn't even have a working dead bolt or telephone. The AC unit did not have temp control knobs, the phone jack was ripped out of the wall, no clothes hanging rack, no cold water in the sink, no remote for the tv that only had 4 channels, paint spattered all over the bathroom and they charged me full price. The free continental breakfast they boasted turned out to be a voucher for coffee, oj and toast in the restaurant. They moved me to an efficiency on Sunday, the inside of the microwave is full of food debris, there is no cover on the bathroom light, the cover on the AC is falling off and I had to prop my foot on the wall to get enough leverage to pull the faucet on in the shower. I was promised a 20 minute wait at the airport for the free airport shuttle, after 3 phone calls to the hotel and 1 hour 20 minutes, the shuttle finally arrived. This moring the elevator is out of order, so we can't use the luggage carts. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to someone I didn't like, much less a friend. I'm currently reevaluating my Choice Privileges membership, and I'm not likely to keep it.

Reviews.Title: “I liked this place! (and the free shuttle is great) Good restaurant too!”
Reviews.Author: cruiseman8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the rodeway inn last year and I'm happy to say that it is in better conditioned. The rooms are renovated and cleaned. I will truely recommend this hotel to others. I stayed here because I went on a cruise. I like the fact that they provided free transportation to the port of Miami. I saved at least $65.00 in taxi fees because they also picked me up at the airport for free. The restaurant was nice and I was able to have a drink and watch the Miami heat game on their flat screen television and eat outside at the wooden patio deck in a nice relaxing setting.

Reviews.Title: “NASTY could not stay SCARY location BEWARE RUDE”
Reviews.Author: toplesstaco
Reviews.Content: NASTY...RUDE...SCARY Our first clue was when the pickup driver arrived late, after all the other hotel vans had come by several times. Then the driver could speak only a little English. Advertised as a hotel close to the airport, it was a 20 minute drive at 9:30 p.m. on a Monday night, a long drive downtown, to a hotel with security windows and cameras everywhere indicating the quality of neighborhood. Then two RUDE women sat behind the counter, and appeared that we were a distraction to whatever they were doing. Having booked on the internet, no where did I read that the shuttle is ONLY operating from 7 a.m. until 11 p.m. Even the marque in the Miami International airport states airport shuttle, implying 24 hour, NOT correct, as they told us that it was a $20.00 taxi ride to the airport. It was altogether a scary place and not indicative of past Rodeway Inns I've stayed in. We left WITHOUT staying in a room, for fear.

Reviews.Title: “Free Shuttles = Stress-free travel”
Reviews.Author: piernikm
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it had free shuttles to/from the Miami airport and free shuttles to the cruise ports (the reason for the trip). The van came fast to the airport. We were able to get directions to "Bayside" and a $10 cab to the most wonderful place in Miami [open air mall, w/ many bars & restaurants]. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The pool was nice and the room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “$1,000,000 can't fix this place!”
Reviews.Author: cruisepegs
Reviews.Content: This hotel has had three other names in a very short time. If you want to look up reviews under the other names they are Comfort Inn Suites Days Inn Travel Inn Civic/Medical Center I warned my father and the gentleman who kindly booked our group trip that we should not stay at a hotel where one of the reviews on this site said, "Run Forrest Run." I knew that trying to save a few bucks wasn't going to be worth this hotel. But the nice man who booked our trip assured us that hotel management had just completed a $1,000,000 renovation. I told them they were foolish to believe this but what do I know? My parents room's toilet did not flush. Ever! They complained and asked for maintenance and they never came. Not ever. My mom took a shower and the tub would not drain. Ever. All of our rooms smelled like Ant Spray. So bad that when you licked your lips you could taste it. Our air conditioner didn't work. And honestly we didn't need it because it was cool the night we were there but the problem was it was shut off and wouldn't quit running. Well it kinda did. It would shut off and then start up again and shut off and start up again. But it was in the off position. (That actually wasn't a huge problem but an annoyance) You can tell as soon as you pull up that this place is not well maintained. We did eat at the restaurant located in the hotel and the food was fine. But Continental breakfast was the joke of the day!!! A 4 oz juice and 1 slice of toast, oh and 1 cup of coffee ! ROTFLOLPIMP! I kid you not! So of course we ended up BUYING a real breakfast. You had to ask for butter. They weren't giving it to you without asking. We were told when we called before the trip that there was a store within 5 minutes walking distance. (We wanted to buy water and coke products to take on our cruise) Well I don't know how fast the person who told us that walks but it takes a lot longer than 5 minutes to walk 8 blocks. The waitress told us (4 females) not to walk outside around the hotel at night because it was not safe. There were no redeeming qualities about this hotel at all. We aren't picky either. Give us a clean place to sleep and give us what you promise and we are happy. This place was a dump. Very dirty, bad location, staff was not helpful in the least. I hope if you are reading this and someone is trying to convince you to stay here that you tell them, "No WAY!" I wish I'd been that smart. lol! We did live to tell the tale but NEVER AGAIN!!! Listen to the bad reviews about this place. They are right on the money.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel offers FREE Transportation,”
Reviews.Author: jojo6996
Reviews.Content: Very convenient when you are taking a cruise.The Free movie with brad Pit was good along with the other current movies. Usually they charge $4.99 per movie and I watch 3 movies for free

Reviews.Title: “NASTY PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: starrs13
Reviews.Content: This place was a Terrible idea. NEVER again will I stay at this place. Was very filthy, unsafe, faucet in bathroom was broke. Bed broke, leg gashed. An accident report was made but nothing was done about this incident. This place should be shut down by the Health Dept. The Office Personal was very RUDE...and was NOT helpful at all. Internet does not work even though you pay for it. They don't tell you the internet is down until you have paid the $5.00 for 30 minutes. Over all....pay the extra for a Holiday Inn or any other Motel besides this one.

Reviews.Title: “Much better service”
Reviews.Author: MiamiJojo69
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel before and were not very happy but we decided to Give the hotel another chance because it was near the hospital. To our surprise the newly renovated rooms were very nice. The new furniture, carpet and flat Screen TV really made a difference. This Hotel has improved a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor”
Reviews.Author: KA1Atlanta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this motel because I had some reward points and since I was in Miami for several days, all 3 nights were free. This property is run down, poorly kept-up, and in an unsafe neightborhood. I came out of my room one morning to find a dead bird lying outside my door. One side of the building had a huge 10 x 40-ft open dumpster in the middle of the parking lot. What a wonderful sight to wake up to when you step out of your room in the morning. Don't worry about losing your appetite for breakfast, though.... The "complimentary" breakfast--despite being a Choice Hotel, this place doesn't serve breakfast, they give their guests a voucher for the restaurant adjacent to the property. The restaurant will give you a glass of juice and ONE piece of toast. If you want anything else, you have to pay for it. Water pressure is very poor, had difficulty flushing toilet as a result. Fortunately, I spent little time at the property, as I was out and around Miami throughout the daytime and only came back to the motel to sleep. At least the place was conveniently close to a public transit station, so getting to downtown Miami was quick and easy. They also offered free shuttle service to the airport (which was 5 minutes away). Still, it's a very nasty property. If you can afford it, I recommend staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Save your Money - Don't Stay”
Reviews.Author: Eathere
Reviews.Content: Miami: The Rodeway Inn Miami Airport Date: October 4th 2008 Reviewer: London UK If I told you the hotel appears to have had three different trading names in recent years, what would that tell you about the hotel!! We stayed on the 4th Oct, and regret ever making the booking. When you check the Hotel's web site they claim they have just be renovated, what they forget to say is that the renovations are of such a poor quality that I hate to think what the hotel was like before. Paint applied to peeling wall paper, re-plastered walls which have not been smoothed out but painted over, bathrooms that have a yellow/nicotine coloured lamp shade - have I painted a pleasant environment to sleep in? As for the corridors, discarded TVs just blocking the hallways, Fire Exit signs pointing the wrong way or broken, lifts/elevators that are so tatty you do not feel safe in. Shuttle service, well on the Sunday of my departure (approx 11:00am) there were approximately 20 people wishing to use the service to the airport & cruise port, but only one vehicle that has seen better days. The hotel staff do not communicate with clients, lifts are out of action but no signs informing the customer. If you ask for the duty manager, make sure it is between Monday thru Friday, as there are no management on duty at weekends it would seem! When the management did eventually contact me by email (only because I complained to Choice Hotels Head Office - who were excellent), they sent me a standard letter, which I replied too, and still waiting a response after over a week. The management are not interested - the staff are not interested! Do not stay at this hotel, there has to be better hotels - they cannot get much worse!

HotelInfo.Name: Rodeway Inn Miami Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 1050 NW 14th Street, Miami, FL 33136
